summary: Replace the existing WaveCraft Pro build plan with a Vizzy-style, fully functional browser-based music visualizer SaaS spec: audio upload + analysis, multiple visualizer types, rich customization panel, multi-aspect canvas system, export system, optional user accounts/projects, and mobile-first dark modern UI with strong Android performance requirements. (Backend/export tech stack choice remains unresolved vs prior IC/Motoko + ffmpeg.wasm constraints.)
architectural_notes: Treat any UI sections/options marked “Coming Soon” (per user screenshots) as required for full implementation now; remove “Coming Soon” placeholders and wire them to real functionality (background controls, text/branding controls, and any other options shown).

Add a new left-sidebar section for Creations/Templates: gallery view includes built-in templates + user-generated projects; define a publish/share flag to control inclusion in the public/creations gallery.

Add a right-side Controls tab/panel for a Presets & Particles Library with instant tap-to-apply behavior; include preset categories covering visualizers, backgrounds, effects, fonts, and particle packs.

Presets expansion: add a large/unlimited batch of high-complexity built-in presets spanning all categories (visualizer/background/text-font/particles/effects) with mixed styles, and ship them embedded in-app (no external browsing dependency).
Particle overlay must be fully transparent (no background panel/blur/backdrop); render only particle dots on top of the background image and visualizer so uploaded background images remain visible.

Project scope change: previous WaveCraft Pro plan is replaced by the Vizzy-style master spec; reconcile backend/export/storage architecture later (Vizzy prompt requests Node/Express + DB + server-side FFmpeg, which may conflict with existing IC/Motoko + ffmpeg.wasm approach).
known_issues: Mobile layout issue: preview area overlaps Audio Upload/Audio Editing panels on small screens, making controls hard to use.
Bug/UX: background particles layer is currently obscuring uploaded background images; particles should render with a transparent backdrop so only dots are visible.

existing_features.title: Build the WaveCraft Pro web app as a mobile-first creator tool optimized for Android Chrome: responsive layouts that start with small screens, touch-friendly controls, and a creator-dashboard UI (left sidebar navigation, center live preview canvas, right-side controls panel, and a top bar with Save and Export).
Remove/omit all monetization and plan-gating: no subscriptions, no Stripe, no paid plans, no pro feature gates, and ensure all features are available to the site owner with no restrictions.
Implement audio upload and playback using a single Web Audio API AudioContext instance with efficient decoding and analysis for MP3/WAV files, supporting real-time preview without lag.

Implement a lightweight visualizer engine that renders smoothly with a 30fps cap by default, uses requestAnimationFrame efficiently, and avoids React re-renders during animation (store animation state in refs, not React state).

Provide modular visualizer modes with configurable parameters, including: circular spectrum, horizontal bar equalizer, vertical bar equalizer, waveform line, radial neon ring, particle-reactive mode, minimal lo‑fi soft glow mode, and an optional WebGL 3D tunnel mode that can be disabled for performance.

Implement audio analysis features needed for band-reactive visuals: FFT spectrum plus bass/mid/treble separation, a sensitivity slider, and (best-effort) BPM detection for display/use in animation timing.
Add editing controls for audio timing and transitions: trim audio range (start/end), fade in, and fade out, ensuring preview remains responsive.
Add background customization options for the video: solid color, multi-stop gradient builder, image upload background, and subtle animated particles overlay.

Add text and branding overlays: song title, artist name, font selection (from bundled fonts), position/size controls, entrance animation presets, and a logo upload overlay. Keep a watermark overlay as an optional toggle only (default off) with no plan gating.

Implement in-browser MP4 export using ffmpeg.wasm (no server-side rendering) with settings for 720p/1080p/4K, 30/60fps, bitrate selection, estimated file size and render-time estimate, and an export progress indicator.

Implement an in-app render queue for exports that runs client-side (since server-side queues are not available): allow users to enqueue multiple export jobs, view job status, cancel a job, and run jobs sequentially.
Add project persistence so users can save/load “projects” (audio reference metadata + visual settings) using the Motoko backend; include basic CRUD: create, list, load, rename, delete.

Create a landing/marketing page with a modern SaaS-style layout (hero, demo preview section, feature highlights, visualizer showcase, pricing section without payments, FAQ, and CTA), and include the user’s Facebook page link: https://www.facebook.com/share/14SsrwttdEB/

Apply a coherent premium dark visual theme consistently across landing + app (typography, spacing, components). Avoid blue/purple as the primary palette; use a dark charcoal base with high-contrast accent colors and clear visual hierarchy suitable for creator tools.

Add production-level reliability and performance safeguards: error boundaries for key UI areas, graceful handling of export failures, memory/resource cleanup (AudioContext nodes, object URLs, animation loops), and lazy-load heavy modules (ffmpeg.wasm, optional 3D) only when needed.

Replace the placeholder “Background controls coming soon” UI with fully functional Background controls, including: solid color background, multi-stop gradient background builder, image upload background, and a subtle animated particles overlay; all controls must update the live preview immediately without noticeable lag on mobile.

Implement the Text & Branding (Overlays) controls to fully replace the “Overlay controls coming soon” placeholder, including: song title text, artist name text, font selection from bundled fonts, position controls, size controls, entrance animation preset selection, logo upload overlay, and an optional watermark toggle (default off); overlays must render in the live preview.

Implement the “3D Tunnel (Heavy)” visualizer mode as a real WebGL-based 3D tunnel mode (not a “coming soon” text stub), and provide a clear on/off performance-safe behavior so devices can switch away without crashes or memory leaks.

Replace the placeholder Export panel (“Export controls coming soon”) with functional in-browser MP4 export UI and flow consistent with the existing Export feature set (ffmpeg.wasm, resolution/FPS/bitrate controls, time+size estimates, progress indicator, and client-side render queue).

Persist all newly-enabled “Coming Soon” settings (Background settings, Text & Branding settings, and 3D Tunnel mode selection/settings where applicable) in Projects so users can Save and later Load a project and see the same preview configuration restored.
Add a new left-sidebar navigation section labeled "Creations/Templates" that opens a dedicated gallery view inside the existing creator dashboard layout.
Implement a Creations/Templates gallery UI that displays (1) built-in starter templates and (2) user-generated projects that are published/shared.
Add backend support for built-in starter templates that can be listed by the frontend and used to create a new user project from a selected template.
Add a publish/unpublish capability for projects, and ensure only published projects appear in the Creations/Templates gallery under user-generated creations.
Add React Query hooks and cache invalidation for templates listing, published creations listing, and publish/unpublish mutations.

Fix the mobile/tablet creator layout so the Preview canvas never overlaps or blocks the Audio Upload / Audio Editing controls (and other control panels) on small screens; the preview and controls must remain fully usable with touch scrolling.
Add a professional “Presets & Particles” library as a new right-side controls tab/panel (not a sidebar item) that can be opened from within the existing creator dashboard layout.

Implement built-in preset categories inside the Presets & Particles library for: (1) Visualizer presets, (2) Background presets, (3) Text/Font presets, (4) Particle packs, and (5) Additional “effects-style” presets that map onto existing settings (e.g., sensitivity/band multipliers, background particles toggles, overlay animation/size/position) without adding any internet browsing/search dependency.

Enable instant tap-to-apply behavior: when a user taps a preset/pack, it is applied immediately to the live preview by updating the appropriate Zustand stores (visualizer/background/overlays) with no confirmation dialog required; include a lightweight toast/snackbar confirming what was applied.

Polish the Presets & Particles library for a “professional” feel: add search/filter within the library (local-only), category chips/tabs, consistent spacing/typography with the existing premium dark theme, and ensure smooth performance on mobile (avoid unnecessary React re-renders during preview animation).

Expand the built-in Presets & Particles library by adding a large batch of additional built-in presets across ALL existing categories (visualizers, backgrounds, text-fonts, particles, effects) in the presets catalog, using mixed aesthetic styles and higher-complexity combinations (especially in the effects category combining visualizer + background + overlay + particles settings).

Ensure all newly added presets can be applied instantly from the PresetsParticlesPanel without runtime errors, and that applying any new preset updates the live preview by correctly driving the existing Zustand stores via applyPreset.
Keep the presets catalog organized and maintainable as it grows: group presets clearly by category within the catalog file and ensure category labels and filtering remain correct for all categories.

Decouple the Background panel’s “Particles” tab from the actual background render type so enabling/configuring particles never replaces/hides the currently selected background (Solid/Gradient/Image). The particles feature must behave as a fully transparent overlay that only draws particle dots on top of whatever background is selected.

Update background settings state handling to avoid treating “particles” as a persisted/rendered background type; instead, persist particles as independent settings (enabled/density/intensity) that can be active alongside Solid/Gradient/Image backgrounds. Ensure loading older saved settings that contain type="particles" does not cause the preview background to become a solid fallback that hides the uploaded image.

Ensure the live preview rendering order remains: background (Solid/Gradient/Image) → visualizer → particles overlay (if enabled) → text/logo/watermark overlays, with no background-type branch that bypasses image rendering when particles are enabled.

Add a canvas aspect-ratio system to the live preview and export settings with selectable presets: 16:9 (1280x720), 9:16 (1080x1920), and 1:1 (1080x1080). The preview must scale responsively to available space while preserving the selected aspect ratio, and the selected aspect ratio must be persisted in saved projects and restored on load.

Implement an "Animation smoothing" control that reduces jitter in audio-reactive visuals by smoothing the analysis/derived amplitude signals used by the visualizer engine. The smoothing value must update the live preview immediately and be persisted in projects.
Add best-effort beat detection output to the audio engine and expose beat events (timestamps) for UI and visualizer use, without degrading mobile performance.

Add a bottom timeline area in the creator UI that visualizes the loaded audio duration and current trim range, and can display beat markers derived from beat detection. The timeline must not block or overlap existing control panels on small screens.

Upgrade the Audio Upload experience to include: drag-and-drop upload support, a max file size limit of 50MB with a clear validation error, and a basic waveform or amplitude preview after upload (lightweight and mobile-safe).

Implement project autosave every 30 seconds for authenticated users when a project is loaded/active and there are unsaved changes. Autosave must be network-efficient (avoid repeated saves when nothing changed) and provide clear UI feedback (e.g., "Saving…" / "Saved").

Add a share-link capability for projects that generates a URL a user can copy. The share link must open a view that can load the shared/published project configuration for viewing (read-only is acceptable), and access must respect the existing published/shared flags on the backend.
Add a one-click "YouTube-ready" export preset that preconfigures export settings to 1280x720 (16:9) with sensible default FPS/bitrate, while keeping the existing export flow and estimates consistent.

Update the mobile UI to support a collapsible settings/controls area (while keeping the existing stacked layout), ensuring touch-friendly interaction and that the preview remains visible and usable without controls overlapping it.

new_feature_requests.summary: Adopt Vizzy-style master spec as the new scope for the visualizer web app (replaces prior WaveCraft Pro plan)
Canvas system: selectable aspect ratios (16:9, 9:16, 1:1) with responsive scaling preview and GPU-accelerated high-performance rendering
Add animation response controls: animation smoothing slider plus beat detection support (for smoother, less jittery visuals)
UI/UX updates per Vizzy prompt: glassmorphism-style panels, bottom timeline, mobile stacked layout with collapsible settings and touch-optimized sliders
User/projects system upgrades: optional signup/login, autosave every 30 seconds, re-edit/delete saved projects
Advanced extras (if possible): beat marker timeline, keyframe animation, share link to project, and one-click YouTube-ready export preset
